bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 81 (Monday, May 23, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SMITH of Missouri:H.R. 5305.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2: The Congress shall havePower to dispose of and make all needful Rules andRegulations respecting the Territory or other Propertybelonging to the United States; and nothing in thisConstitution shall be so construed as to Prejudice any Claimsof the United States, or of any particular State.[Page H2962]

item.title: Ste. Genevieve National Historical Park Establishment Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 605.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Ste. Genevieve National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2016

This bill establishes the Ste. Genevieve National Historic Site in Missouri as a unit of the National Park System.

Interior may acquire, by donation, purchase, or exchange, any land or interest in land located within the boundary of the Historic Site or any nationally significant property identified in the special resource study that is within the Ste. Genevieve Historic District National Historic Landmark.

bill.title: Ste. Genevieve National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2016

item.title: Ste. Genevieve National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2016
To establish the Ste. Genevieve National Historic Site in the State of Missouri, and for other purposes.
Ste. Genevieve National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
